result.execSummary:
The defendant Alberto T Diaz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any previously imposed sentences.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  
++Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++Pay DNA surcharge.  - DNA sample previously provided.  Do not reside with any person in any place in which children reside w/o court's permission.    If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  May Not have contact with Jennifer W.  Not to reside with anyone of the opposite sex, except his mother unless minors reside there.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or ciminal charge made against the deft.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any previously imposed sentences.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
deft placed on probation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances as before.  Defense counsel reports the deft wishes to enter a plea to all counts.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to all four counts; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Jurors reconvene @ 9:29am.  Court thanks them for the service.  Jurors are released @ 9:31am.  Court takes a short recess to review the sentencing transcript and PSI from 15CF840.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for three years on each count concurrent but consecutive to any previously imposed sentences.  See conditions.  DNA sample previously provided; DNA surcharge is ordered.  Appeal rights.
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  Voir dire commences @ 9:50am.  Jury selected @ 11:10am.  Unselected jurors released for the day.  Few preliminary instructions given to the jurors.  Selected jurors released for the day @ 11:37am; instructed to return @ 9am on 8/29/17.
Deft's Notice of Amended Witness List - filed by Atty. Michael Barth  kmk

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Atty Michael Barth appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not produced from Oshkosh Corr.  FPT adj to 3/17/17 @ 10am

Minutes:  15CF840/15CM1115.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michael Barth.  

15CF840 - Case is not resolved.  Ludwig hrg held.  JS to commence shortly; deft will be sentenced on 15CM419 first.  Court takes a short break to handle other cases.  Court reconvenes.  Deft has decided to accept the offer; new factor is that the deft was just sentenced on 15CM419 about 30 minutes ago.  Court will allow the plea agreement to proceed.  Deft pleads no contest to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Counts 2, 4, & 5 are dismissed on State's motion.  Count 3 is dismissed & read-in on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 2/20/17 @ 9am.

15CM1115 - case set for FPT along w/sentencing on 15CF840 on 2/20/17 @ 9am.
